eventName: The Black Forest Wills A Dream
storyInfo: Gitano returns to her tribe after foreseeing her brother's death. Santalla tracks the trail of the Ursus infiltrators, warning Magallan and Typhon to be careful before leaving.

attributes.content: Ragna, Ragna.
attributes.name: Sami Wetlands Shaman

attributes.content: How should we welcome you?
attributes.name: Sami Wetlands Shaman

attributes.content: From either the north or the south, you were always the least likely to return of those who left.
attributes.name: Sami Wetlands Shaman

attributes.content: I know no one invited me.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: But I saw a vision in my crystal ball.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: ...A vision of my brother's death.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: What a beautiful sculpture! Does the little guy in the nutshell really point the way?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: And this Originium crystal! What an unusual color!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: How do you keep the crystal stable while sculpting?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: No, wait, isn't it dangerous to have a piece of Originium as a home decoration?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Analysis on the Originium ice crystal I brought back last time isn't finished yet, but more importantly... it's so beautiful!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Let's see... I think I have a few coins left from my last trip to Ursus!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Or do you only accept bartering, like the local Sami?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I can spare a can of seasoning to trade... But that would mean Simone and Typhon would have to eat bland Sami food with me.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: ...We're Sami to begin with.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: What do you actually want, girl? We'll be on our way if you have nothing to trade.
attributes.name: Ursus Caravan Member

attributes.content: Oh, sorry, was I too loud? Haha...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I didn't think the Ursus caravans would come all the way up here, bringing so much stuff I've never seen!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: What did you say you needed, Simone?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: ...Simone?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: You really didn't hear, did you?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Wh-What?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Someone recognized her and asked for her help.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Some bodies have been brought back to the tribe, but they don't have a Snowpriest, so they asked Simone to check them instead.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Oh, so people died...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: No wonder the market's been so quiet. No one seemed interested in talking.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Everybody looks so depressed.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: They didn't put up much for sale, either.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Let's wait for Simone, then. She insisted on coming to the market, so she can decide.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Is that okay, my friends from Ursus?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: O water that flows across the land of Sami. Allow me to speak to your children.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (Low humming)
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Wind.
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: From the lowest branch of the old tree, to the torch in front of Grandma Vali's door...
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: O great merciful fate.
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: It is assented. Go ahead, daughter of the Santalla Tree. Here are their belongings.
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: I am grateful to earn the trust of a root of Frost Maple.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: There is red frost on the weapons. They were in battle.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Are these warriors from the northern front?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Yes, they left the tribe for the northern lands seven or eight years ago.
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: Who could have guessed that the two tribesmen who'd left home the longest, who were the least willing to look back, would come home on the same day?
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: Are you referring to the dead?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: ...A brother and sister who had parted ways.
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: Fate has also brought you here today. Perhaps you should hear the story.
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: You must remember the great snowfall that covered half of Myrkwood.
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Our clan was affected too.
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: Like the other clans trapped in the blizzard, we prayed for Sami's wisdom and braved the wind and snow to seek messages atop trees, all to learn how we might protect ourselves.
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: But we did not have a Snowpriest.
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: We prayed and prayed, but received nothing but silence.
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: There was no guidance from fate, and our shamans could not determine whether to stay or not, or if we left, to where?
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: That was when those two siblings stepped forward to lead.
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: But their thoughts took them in opposite directions.
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: The older brother answered Eikthyrnir's call and brought his band to the northern front, to stop the snowfall for the rest of the tribe and spare them the need to leave.
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: I see, accepting guidance from a Snowpriest outside the tribe in desperate circumstances.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Meanwhile, the younger sister felt that we could not afford to wait for the snowfall to end.
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: Using her Arts to foresee danger, she led the rest of the tribe southwards, eventually settling here.
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: It couldn't have been an easy journey.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: ...For either of them.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: So we can understand why they hated each other enough to never look back.
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: Ha, my sister and I butted heads for months after I broke one of her horn ornaments. What is a mere seven or eight years to their differences?
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: ...*sigh*.
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: The blessed words carved into the side of his drum are all faded now. I would have redone them for him, if he'd come back even once over the last few years.
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: This drum...
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: There's no blood on it at all.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: But the shaman who owned it was clearly badly wounded.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: I suspect... he didn't have his weapon when he was injured.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: There's half a bottle of vodka in his fur coat.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Ha, the bitter brew that the Ursus squeeze from steel. Did they drink with the Ursus by the fireside?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Who brought back these warriors' bodies?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: An Ursus caravan. Why?
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: 'Checking status of Black Mark. Liebafowl is about to trade with those upon water.'
Are they still here?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: They usually don't stay for long. The path ahead is treacherous when the sun has set.
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: Thank you. I must find them... and ask some questions.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Wait... will you come back, Santalla?
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: We're a withering clan... We could use all the help we can get.
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: This ceremony means much to us.
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: It's not just a sendoff for the dead, but also a chance for the living to bid farewell to their homeland. The more learned shamans there are, the better protected our people will be.
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: ...Clan migration.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Nearly a hundred years later, does the Samivilinn once again guide you on a great migration to the south?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Yes. This time, the Samivilinn gazes upon us.
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: We can recognize the signs.
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: Newborns crying all night, dead beasts by ponds...
attributes.name: Grieving Apprentice Shaman

attributes.content: (Signs of fear.)
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (Has demonic corruption spread all the way from the icefield to the southern wetlands?)
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (Or could the Black Mark that Ursus placed on Sami be...)
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: I have an inkling of the signs you speak of.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: I promise I'll be back for the ceremony.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: But... I have other matters to attend to for now.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: The spirits of the dead are watching. The living must bring them peace.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Is it really that bad when you don't have a Snowpriest?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Is that enough of a reason for things to be going badly for the tribe?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Yeah.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: (Takes notes) 'Snowpriests protect their tribe through soothsaying...'
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: 'Tribes without a Snowpriest may be unable to detect impending Catastrophes.'
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: So a Snowpriest has to study like a Catastrophe Messenger then...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: You don't become a Snowpriest just by studying.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: I've seen Snowpriests-in-training in the tundras, on the brink of death as they go through their trials.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Other tribes wait for a revelation from Sami. Those who become Snowpriests receive miraculous instructions.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Anyway, you should talk to Simone about it. All I'm telling you is to stop asking around the market.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: This tribe is like a sick hornbeast. It's going to get irritated if you keep poking at it and telling it to get up.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Sorry...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Also, this bracelet you picked isn't just ugly, it's bothersome too.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Hehe, that was just an excuse to get you to come to the market with me.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: You're almost fully Sami by now. You don't need me to accompany you in the south, where metal things are plentiful.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Still, I feel better with you around.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I'm not sure why, but I'm getting a bad feeling.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: ...Do your bad feelings have a habit of coming true?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Not really.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I hardly ever get them in the first place.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Tell me more.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Did it feel like a mangler's shadow, or a crack on a great tree?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: No, it's not like that...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Wait, a mangler? There are manglers here? Will you take care of it if we run into one?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: *sigh* I'll teach you to protect yourself again before we go.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: What I'm asking is, what form does your bad feeling take?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Hm...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: To me at least, you call it a 'bad feeling' precisely because it's vague and ambiguous.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: It's like, I felt something come close, but failed to notice it.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Or like there's something huge just beneath the layer of snow, but I walked right over it.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Which Professor Mary says I do a lot, come to think of it.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Ah... Ah-choo!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Hey, it's snowing harder.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Oh, there you are, Simone!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Have you seen an Ursus caravan?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Yeah. They gave me an empty flagon while saying stuff like 'His Majesty' and 'The border patrol won't like it.' Here.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I was waiting for you to get back, to see if you needed to trade with them for anything, but they were in a hurry.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: ...So you let them leave?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: They went that way. You should be able to catch up.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: You're angry, Simone.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: What happened?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Sorry... I was just thinking about how to return the favor for their gift.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Magallan, Typhon, the two of you head towards Čappat with the rest of the tribe. And be careful along the way.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: If there's a problem, don't try to deal with it, just run. Your lives come first.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Same to you, Simone.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Heh, you needn't worry about me.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: I'll catch up with you soon. I promised to attend the funeral of these warriors.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: What are you thinking, Maggy?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: That's weird.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I was going to ask Simone what the Sami writing on this flagon means.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: But I got distracted for some reason.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Well, I'll just put it away for now.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: They came back, Ragna.
attributes.name: Mild-Mannered Shaman

attributes.content: Your predictions are always so accurate.
attributes.name: Mild-Mannered Shaman

attributes.content: Tila came back empty-handed. She's the best hunter in the tribe.
attributes.name: Mild-Mannered Shaman

attributes.content: And my youngest son found a bracelet that had been lost for years. As you said, 'Fortune lies in deep water.'
attributes.name: Mild-Mannered Shaman

attributes.content: And...
attributes.name: Mild-Mannered Shaman

attributes.content: Dark death has befallen our warriors.
attributes.name: Mild-Mannered Shaman

attributes.content: Therefore, I must ask you: Why did you do it?
attributes.name: Mild-Mannered Shaman

attributes.content: Why did you lead us in the opposite direction, when your scrying pointed towards the north?
attributes.name: Mild-Mannered Shaman

attributes.content: ...Sorry, I only came back to see my family.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: If there are no other funeral arrangements... I'll take my leave.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: Ragna!
attributes.name: Mild-Mannered Shaman

attributes.content: Let her go.
attributes.name: Stern Shaman

attributes.content: She is no longer connected to the land of Sami. We need not reproach the poor soul.
attributes.name: Stern Shaman

attributes.content: How was it, Gitano?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: They still don't like you?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I predicted as much.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: Well... at least you ran into an old friend on the way. That's pretty lucky too!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I can still hardly believe it. I thought I was hallucinating again when I saw you!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: —Er, sorry.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I heard someone died. Could it be...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: It's okay. I came back because I divined my brother's death.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: We'd been out of touch for a long time. We had our... differences.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: But the shamans aren't preparing for a funeral. Don't they have the most important role?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: ...Your friend is sharp, Magallan.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: It's hardly a secret.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: People aren't normally so sad just to say goodbye to the dead.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Only when they never get a chance to.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: ...You're right.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: Seven years have passed. I thought new branches would grow from the trees, and that the people would be able to live in peace on this land.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: But all I see is my kinsmen suffering from increasingly frequent disasters, and even being forced to move again.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: Meanwhile, the shamans argue over whether to hold a traditional funeral.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: Hm... but what use is a goodbye if you don't say anything?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: In the end, everything flies away like a fowlbeast, never to be seen again.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: By that point, it doesn't matter if you were the one to raise your voice and startle them.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: I... never agreed to not hold a funeral. Please don't bring that up again.
attributes.name: Mild-Mannered Shaman

attributes.content: They were fortunate to return home. How could we leave them to the long, cold nights, trapped by their mortal bodies?
attributes.name: Mild-Mannered Shaman

attributes.content: This place will soon stop being our home.
attributes.name: Stern Shaman

attributes.content: Which is exactly why they need the boat-sinking ceremony, so that the river may carry them home!
attributes.name: Mild-Mannered Shaman

attributes.content: Disaster lies before us.
attributes.name: Stern Shaman

attributes.content: I know—
attributes.name: Mild-Mannered Shaman

attributes.content: —And they are part of it.
attributes.name: Stern Shaman

attributes.content: The rockhorn runs for its life, day and night, until it finally dies of exhaustion. It is a sign. On the northern front, we will blow the horn and stand watch at night.
attributes.name: Stern Shaman

attributes.content: They are all warriors.
attributes.name: Stern Shaman

attributes.content: A warrior does not die in peace.
attributes.name: Stern Shaman

attributes.content: Wasn't that just a rumor?
attributes.name: Mild-Mannered Shaman

attributes.content: Fighting on the northern icefields did not darken your fate. Instead, you received Sami's revelation and blessing.
attributes.name: Mild-Mannered Shaman

attributes.content: Yet now you want them to stand vigil over their own bodies, until they rot and decay...
attributes.name: Mild-Mannered Shaman

attributes.content: Among them lies your favorite student. Even now he is listening to your cold words.
attributes.name: Mild-Mannered Shaman

attributes.content: Then let him listen. He is a strong warrior. He will understand.
attributes.name: Stern Shaman

attributes.content: —You're right.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: Why don't we ask the dead themselves?
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: ...It would seem living among the outlanders has given you blind courage.
attributes.name: Stern Shaman

attributes.content: But you know that we have long lacked a Snowpriest.
attributes.name: Stern Shaman

attributes.content: No one in the clan has heard the call since Grandma Vali's passing.
attributes.name: Stern Shaman

attributes.content: Or do you propose that we break from tradition and imitate those tribes that set trials for their Snowpriests, rather than wait for the call?
attributes.name: Stern Shaman

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: I... can try to divine their will.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: Ragna...
attributes.name: Mild-Mannered Shaman

attributes.content: Yes, I'm asking you to entrust it to fate.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: I won't take any questions. Just think of me as someone who goes back on her word.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: Then I won't stop you from trying.
attributes.name: Stern Shaman

attributes.content: ...Very well, if the clan tree raises its branches and lets you sail through, I won't stop you.
attributes.name: Mild-Mannered Shaman

attributes.content: We await the answer of the dead.
attributes.name: Mild-Mannered Shaman

attributes.content: Weren't you going to Čappat? I thought you southerners were always in such a hurry.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Like when your tourists come to visit. Their, er, vehicles just drop them off somewhere empty, they all stand around a while, and then the vehicle takes them away again.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: You're right, I am concerned about Professor Mary.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: But my best bet for now is to gather as much information about Sami as possible, to make things smoother for the rescue team.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Plus, I want to spend more time with Gitano.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: At Rhodes Island, they always say that nothing can rattle her except losing at cards.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: So I never thought I'd see her looking so gloomy...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: What about you, Typhon? Isn't your client down south in Čappat getting impatient?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: No idea.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I don't actually know who the client waiting for me there is, or what they want me to do.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Probably another one who wants me to help deal with a problem quietly.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: You can tag along next time. It's amazing what they'll do to keep things secret.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Like, leaving a message on a wooden board in a hole in a tree. When it was just about removing a dead hornbeast.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: The shadow was no longer near the beast, but that just makes them even more scared. So they look to me to take care of it.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Sounds like people trust you a lot.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: So do they really keep their distance from you just because they think your bow brings bad luck?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Isn't that just like... Oripathy?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Oripathy? Of course not, it's nothing like that.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Do you no longer respect Simone because she has Oripathy?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: But me... I'm not sure I've fully tamed this bow, to be honest.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Hm... but you're the one holding it. If it's not working right, wouldn't that be like when my drones malfunction? You can feel when something's wrong, right?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Of course I can keep an eye on it, when I'm awake.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: But what about when I'm dreaming, and my consciousness leaves my body?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Do you southerners have a saying like this? 'The more people speak of doom, the clearer it casts its shadow.'
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: You don't? Alright.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: When I lived in Arges's cave, no one knew of me or my weapon.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: But things are different now. The more I help chase the shadows out of Sami, the more people begin to talk about me.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: So who can say when misfortune will suddenly catch up with me?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: I'm sure your bow will be fine! We've journeyed all this way together with no problems, haven't we?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Although I guess the plural of anecdote isn't data...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Oh, what if you let my colleagues in Engineering analyze it? Maybe they could come up with an explanation I can actually understand.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: And they might be able to help you.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: My friend Mayer, for example, knows a lot about dealing with dangerous objects.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: And we're super close, so I'm sure she wouldn't mind me filling her lab with potentially risky weapons, haha...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: But research can take a long time, huh. I can't exactly take your weapon from you for years.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Thank you. You're a hard worker.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: But I told you not to touch my bow.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: This is for me to deal with, and only me. That's what Arges said.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: ...What are you doing, Magallan?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Let go.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Magallan lets go without even thinking about it. The splash brings her back to her senses, and she stares at the ripple on the surface of the water.
Wh-What did I just throw in there?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: The flagon the Ursus trader gave you.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: You were scooping up muddy water from the marsh with it.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: I taught you to filter mud and sand with clothes, but... I don't think you forgot. You didn't look right.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Oh! You're right! I somehow got distracted again!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I need to get it back... It was a gift.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: You don't dare reach out, do you?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Yeah.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Give me your hand.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: You know a way to deal with this situation?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: ...Phew.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I feel calmer now.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: That was amazing! With just a vine around my finger!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Oh, you have one around yours too.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Yeah.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: But you shouldn't try to get it back.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Remember what Simone said? Be careful.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Alright...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Strange... That was a defense meant specifically for demons.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Could Simone's warning have meant...
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: ...The dead have answered.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: Most want to be buried.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: One... remained silent.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: Silence means there is no objection, at least?
attributes.name: Mild-Mannered Shaman

attributes.content: We must respect the wishes of the dead.
attributes.name: Mild-Mannered Shaman

attributes.content: ...Very well, we'll hold a funeral as usual.
attributes.name: Stern Shaman

attributes.content: Be careful when you get on the boat, Magallan.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: Thanks!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: This is how the wetland tribes do it.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: The boats are launched once night falls. The river carries them to their final resting place, where they will sink into the water along with the boats.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: Only then can the dead be freed from the shackles of the flesh to walk free amongst the trees, and travel with the flowing water to find their bloodline.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: However, this funeral is also our farewell to our homeland.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: Which is why we will also bring our belongings and travel along with the dead.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: ...These boats will carry the dead home, and the living away from it.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: Can Typhon and I come with you? We're not part of your family or tribe or anything.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Of course you can.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: In fact, I'd appreciate it if you did.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: I've long known that I'm just a lone wanderer, far from Sami... Still, it's painful to have to ride in a boat by myself while saying goodbye to my last blood kin.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: ...At least being able to hold a funeral will comfort the tribe.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: Both the living and the dead.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: What is it, Typhon? Need a hand?
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: It's just that your hand is so cold, Gitano. Like you've been standing in the freezing wind for a long time, and the best you could do was rub your hands together.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: There's something I've been meaning to ask you.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: What did the dead tell you?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Or rather, what was the 'silence' in your divination?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: The horn has been blown. Don't look back.
attributes.name: Sami Wetlands Inhabitant

attributes.content: Fate has instructed us to move forward. What was left behind will eventually return to us.
attributes.name: Sami Wetlands Inhabitant

attributes.content: Row.
attributes.name: Sami Wetlands Inhabitant

attributes.content: There is no more talk. The shaman's song can be heard from the head of the fleet.
The dead follow their ancestors, as their names are read one by one.
A breeze rings a string of bells on the boat carrying the bodies.
The ceremony has begun. The fleet will not turn back.
...I'm sorry.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: The fourth time, I still saw the ceremony.
The fifth time, I asked... Lazal.
Lazal, there's something I want to tell you.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: ...Or maybe it's something I wanted to hear you tell me.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: The road away from that blizzard was long. The river never thawed.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: I lived away from Sami, sailing with a boat of iron. It was so firm and steady that I couldn't help but dream back to how our clansmen dragged their boats across the river.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: Many lost the strength to pull their boats. Some lost the strength to pull even themselves forward.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: ...Too much was lost on that path. I dared not turn back.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: But in the end, that's all there is to it. I dared not turn back.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: We made opposing decisions, and even took up arms against one another, but the reason I never came back wasn't because I resented you.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: ...But perhaps none of that's important to a warrior stationed in the north.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: The leaves in the urn are almost burnt up.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: So please, tell me...
attributes.name: Gitano
Gitano
attributes.content: Why do you—

attributes.name: Gitano
attributes.content: Why do you still refuse to answer, brother?
attributes.joined: Why do you—Why do you still refuse to answer, brother?

attributes.content: Darkness, fog, darkness.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: An empty crystal ball.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: Why do I see nothing?
attributes.name: Gitano
